metadata.feature_description: Retrieve and manage URL management options including locales, status codes, and site aliases

steps.action: Navigate to Content > Pages and select the Home page
steps.expected: Page editing panel opens with page details
steps.actual: Page editing panel opened successfully showing Home page details

steps.action: Click on Advanced tab and then S.E.O. sub-tab, then click Add URL button
steps.expected: Add URL form appears with Site Alias dropdown
steps.actual: Add URL form appeared with Site Alias dropdown showing available options

steps.action: Click on Site Alias dropdown to view available locale-specific aliases
steps.expected: Dropdown displays all available locales with their site aliases
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed three locale options: localhost:8081, localhost:8081/en-us (English), localhost:8081/es-es (Spanish)

steps.action: In the Add URL form, click on URL Type dropdown
steps.expected: Dropdown displays all supported HTTP status codes for URLs
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed two status codes: Active (200) and Redirect (301)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Retrieve site aliases and primary alias

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Site Settings > Site Behavior > Site Aliases tab
steps.expected: Site Aliases configuration panel displays all configured aliases with primary indicator
steps.actual: Site Aliases panel displayed three aliases with columns: ALIAS, BROWSER, THEME, LANGUAGE, and PRIMARY. localhost:8081 is marked as primary

steps.action: View Site Alias Mapping Mode options in Site Aliases tab
steps.expected: URL Mapping section shows available site alias usage modes
steps.actual: URL MAPPING section displayed Site Alias Mapping Mode with options: Canonical (selected), Redirect, and None. Also shows Auto Add Site Alias toggle (Off)

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Site Settings > Languages tab
steps.expected: Languages configuration panel displays enabled locales and their settings
steps.actual: Languages panel displayed two enabled languages: English (United States) marked as default (**) and Español (España). Settings show System Default and Site Default both as English (United States), with Enable Language Parameter in URLs: On and Enable Browser Language Detection: On

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify multi-locale setup with single locale correlation

steps.action: Verify that Site Aliases match configured Languages
steps.expected: Each enabled language should have a corresponding site alias
steps.actual: Verified: en-US locale has localhost:8081/en-us alias, es-ES locale has localhost:8081/es-es alias. Primary alias localhost:8081 serves as the default. Languages and Site Aliases are correctly correlated

observations: The URL Options Configuration feature is accessed through the page-level S.E.O. settings (Content > Pages > [Page] > Advanced > S.E.O.) rather than a dedicated Settings page
Site aliases are configured at the site level under Settings > Site Settings > Site Behavior > Site Aliases
The system supports multi-locale setup with locale-specific site aliases (e.g., localhost:8081/en-us for English, localhost:8081/es-es for Spanish)
Status codes are limited to two options: Active (200) for direct URLs and Redirect (301) for URL redirects
Site Alias Mapping Mode options (Canonical, Redirect, None) control how alternate site aliases are handled
The primary alias (localhost:8081) is clearly marked in the Site Aliases table
